ground_truth: He takes a seat on the couch, opens a folder, and suddenly flinches with a spasm of pain in his shoulder. It is sharp but brief; he notices it, but since it does not continue, he ignores it. Parrish resumes looking at the folder when suddenly the pain returns. Frozen with surprise, Parrish's eyes search the room for the source of the sound; it comes from no particular direction, yet surrounds him. Suddenly Parrish's symptoms sharply intensify; he is sinking to the floor but somehow grabs a corner of the desk, holding on with one hand while clutching his shoulder and arm with the other, as the pain violently seizes the upper part of his body. Parrish grips the edge of the desk, assaulted by pain on one hand, with the Voice coming at him from the outer; each aberration feeds on the other, and he is beside himself, consumed with pain and bewildered by what seems to be a hallucination but which he is certain is not. Parrish is possessed. Parrish gasps. He holds on tight to the corner of the desk, sweat dripping, his skin ashen. Susan at the door now pauses abruptly, her eyes on the Young Man. The Young Man holds the door for Susan as they step out onto the street. Susan is staring at him now; he smiles, all open and vulnerable. Parrish ignores her, his attention taken by the Voice. His eyelids flutter, nonplused, edgy, and fearful. Parrish is confounded. Blindly and disconcerted, he follows Allison and Drew and Quince. Parrish sits. Parrish is on the edge of his seat, struggling to hide his panic. The conversation swirls around Parrish, and he is deaf to it. Parrish is in shock, still striving to gain control of himself. As Coyle serves him, Parrish turns to Luisa. Parrish is stunned. Parrish, spinning with anxiety, tries to summon up his courage to go as Allison continues. Finally, Parrish rises from the table and starts out. Allison is about to press the point but then drifts into disappointed silence as Parrish leaves the room. Parrish moves deliberately down the hall, slowing as he nears the doorway to the library. The door is open. He hesitates before crossing the threshold, taking in as much as his eye can see; tentatively, he enters. A beautiful, classic room with areas of dim, warm light, club chairs, books reaching to the ceiling, a rolling library ladder, a weathered dictionary on a stand, and a model boat carved of bone set into the stacks, which are separated from the reading area by a seven-foot high partition of obscured glass. Parrish, poised in the doorway, looks around, nothing in sight. Parrish is startled; he shrinks backward for a moment, his eyes searching the room for the Voice, the timbre and pitch of which is exactly what he has heard before.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: He occupies a seat on the sofa, opens a dossier, and abruptly flinches with a spasm of agony in his shoulder. It is acute but fleeting; he observes it, but since it does not persist, he disregards it. Parrish resumes examining the dossier when suddenly the agony returns. Immobile with astonishment, Parrish's eyes scour the chamber for the origin of the noise; it emanates from no specific direction, yet envelops him. Suddenly Parrish's symptoms vigorously intensify; he is descending to the ground but somehow grasps a corner of the bureau, clutching on with one hand while grasping his shoulder and arm with the other, as the agony violently seizes the upper part of his torso. Parrish clasps the edge of the bureau, assailed by agony on one hand, with the Voice approaching him from the outer; each deviation feeds on the other, and he is beside himself, consumed with agony and bewildered by what seems to be a hallucination but which he is certain is not. Parrish is possessed. Parrish gasps. He clings tightly to the corner of the bureau, perspiration dripping, his complexion pallid. Susan at the entry now halts abruptly, her eyes on the Young Man. The Young Man holds the entryway for Susan as they proceed onto the thoroughfare. Susan is gazing at him now; he beams, all open and defenseless. Parrish disregards her, his focus taken by the Voice. His eyelids flutter, perplexed, tense, and apprehensive. Parrish is confounded. Blindly and disconcerted, he follows Allison and Drew and Quince. Parrish sits. Parrish is on the brink of his seat, struggling to mask his dread. The dialogue swirls around Parrish, and he is oblivious to it. Parrish is in shock, still endeavoring to regain command of himself. As Coyle serves him, Parrish turns to Luisa. Parrish is astounded. Parrish, whirling with anxiety, tries to summon up his bravery to go as Allison continues. Finally, Parrish rises from the table and begins out. Allison is about to press the matter but then drifts into disappointed silence as Parrish exits the room. Parrish advances deliberately down the corridor, slowing as he approaches the entryway to the library. The entry is open. He hesitates before crossing the boundary, taking in as much as his eye can perceive; tentatively, he enters. A beautiful, classic chamber with areas of dim, warm illumination, club chairs, volumes reaching to the ceiling, a rolling library ladder, a weathered lexicon on a stand, and a model vessel carved of bone set into the stacks, which are separated from the reading vicinity by a seven-foot high partition of obscured glass. Parrish, balanced in the entryway, surveys around, nothing in sight. Parrish is startled; he recoils backward for a moment, his eyes searching the chamber for the Voice, the timbre and pitch of which is precisely what he has heard before.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: A seat is taken by him on the couch, a folder is opened by him, and a spasm of pain suddenly causes him to flinch in his shoulder. It is sharp but brief; it is noticed by him, but since it does not continue, it is ignored by him. The folder is resumed being looked at by Parrish when suddenly the pain returns. Frozen with surprise, the room is searched by Parrish's eyes for the source of the sound; it comes to him from no particular direction, yet surrounds him. Suddenly Parrish's symptoms are sharply intensified; he is sinking to the floor, but somehow a corner of the desk is grabbed by him, holding on with one hand while his shoulder and arm are clutched by the other, as the pain violently seizes the upper part of his body. The edge of the desk is gripped by Parrish, as pain assaults him on one hand, with the Voice coming at him from the outer; each aberration feeds on the other, and he is beside himself, being consumed with pain and bewildered by what seems to be a hallucination but which he is certain is not. Possession grips Parrish. A gasp escapes him. The corner of the desk is held on to tightly by him, sweat dripping, his skin ashen. Susan now pauses abruptly at the door, fixing her eyes on the Young Man. The door is held open by the Young Man for Susan as they step out onto the street. Susan stares at him now; he smiles, all open and vulnerable. She is ignored by Parrish, his attention taken by the Voice. His eyelids flutter, and he is nonplused, edgy, and fearful. Parrish finds himself confounded. Blindly and disconcerted, Allison, Drew, and Quince are followed by him. A seat is taken by Parrish. The edge of his seat is occupied by Parrish, his panic being struggled to be hidden by him. The conversation swirls around Parrish, and it is unheard by him. Shock grips Parrish, still striving to gain control of himself. Coyle serves him, and Parrish turns to Luisa. Stunned is Parrish. Spinning with anxiety, courage is tried to be summoned by Parrish to go as Allison continues. Finally, the table is risen from by Parrish, and he starts out. Allison is about to press the point but then drifts into disappointed silence as Parrish leaves the room. Deliberately down the hall, Parrish moves, slowing as he nears the doorway to the library. The door has been opened. He hesitates before crossing the threshold, taking in as much as his eye can see; he tentatively enters. A beautiful, classic room presents itself with areas of dim, warm light, club chairs, books reaching to the ceiling, a rolling library ladder, a weathered dictionary on a stand, and a model boat carved of bone is set into the stacks, which are separated from the reading area by a seven-foot high partition of obscured glass. Poised in the doorway, Parrish looks around, finding nothing in sight. Startled is Parrish; he shrinks backward for a moment, his eyes searching the room for the Voice, the timbre and pitch of which is exactly what he has heard before.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Parrish sits on the couch, opens a folder, and flinches from a sharp shoulder pain. Brief, he ignores it, but the pain soon returns. Surprised, his eyes dart around for the source of a sound that seems to envelop him. The pain intensifies, and he sinks to the floor, grabbing the desk for support while clutching his shoulder. The pain and a perceived hallucination overwhelm him. Parrish gasps, clinging to the desk, his skin ashen. Susan pauses at the door, noticing the Young Man, who smiles and follows her outside. Parrish, distracted by the Voice, struggles with fear. He follows Allison, Drew, and Quince, sitting at the edge of his seat. Deaf to the surrounding conversation, Parrish fights for composure. Served by Coyle, he turns to Luisa, stunned and anxious. As Allison continues, Parrish rises abruptly, leaving the table. Alison, disappointed, watches him go. Parrish walks deliberately down the hall, hesitating at the library's open door. He enters the classic room with club chairs, towering bookshelves, a ladder, and a bone-carved model boat. Startled, he retreats momentarily, searching for the Voice he recognizes.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Seated on the couch, Parrish opens a folder and flinches from a sharp but brief shoulder pain. Ignoring it initially, he resumes reading, but the pain returns, intensifying sharply. Gripping the desk, seized by pain and confusion, Parrish feels overwhelmed by a hallucination-like experience. As Susan and the Young Man leave, his attention remains on the mysterious Voice. Fluttering eyelids and fear consume him as he follows Allison, Drew, and Quince. Struggling to control his panic, he is deaf to the conversation. Stunned and anxious, he eventually rises and leaves as Allison falls silent. Walking deliberately down the hall, he approaches the library, hesitating at the beautiful room with dim lights and books, entering tentatively. Startled, he searches for the familiar Voice, its pitch and timbre echoing in the room.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
He gently lowers himself onto the comfortable couch, carefully placing a folder on his lap. As he begins to open it, he flinches unexpectedly, his shoulder seized by a sharp, fleeting spasm of pain. The sensation is intense, yet brief; he acknowledges it but decides to dismiss it, reasoning that since it swiftly subsides, it may not be of significant concern. Parrish, feeling slightly relieved, returns his focus to examining the contents of the folder. However, the mysterious pain suddenly resurfaces, taking him by surprise. Startled and confused, Parrish's eyes dart around the room, searching for the source of an elusive sound that seems to envelop him without coming from any discernible direction. Abruptly, the pain escalates with a vicious intensity, forcing him to sink towards the floor. Desperately, he manages to grasp the corner of the desk with one hand while clutching his shoulder and arm with the other, as the excruciating pain grips the upper part of his body with unrelenting force.

In this moment of crisis, Parrish clings to the desk's edge, tormented by the severe pain on one side, while a disorienting Voice seems to assail him from the surrounding atmosphere; each unsettling sensation amplifies the other, and he finds himself overwhelmed, engulfed by the dual terrors of pain and what feels like a hallucination. Yet, he is convinced that this is no figment of his imagination. Parrish feels overcome, and he gasps for breath. Despite the sweat beading down his face, leaving his skin ghostly pale, he holds on tightly to the desk's corner. Meanwhile, Susan hesitates at the door, her eyes fixed on the Young Man who graciously holds the door open for her as they step out onto the street. Susan's gaze remains intently on him; he responds with a smile, wide and unguarded. Parrish, however, pays little heed to her, as his mind is entirely consumed by the Voice. His eyelids flutter restlessly, his expression one of confusion, tension, and apprehension. 

Parrish stands bewildered, and in a state of unease, he follows behind Allison, Drew, and Quince. He takes a seat, perching on the edge as if barely able to contain his rising panic. The conversational chatter swirls around him, but he is oblivious, almost deaf to the surrounding voices. Lost in shock and striving to regain his composure, Parrish is momentarily served by Coyle, prompting him to turn towards Luisa. Still, he is dumbfounded. Struggling with a whirlwind of anxiety, Parrish endeavors to muster the courage to depart as Allison continues her point. Finally, he rises from the table with determination and begins to make his way out. Allison is poised to press her argument further but ultimately fades into a silence of disappointment as Parrish exits the room. Moving with deliberate steps down the hall, he slows his pace as he approaches the doorway to the library.

The door stands open, inviting, yet he hesitates before stepping over the threshold. His eyes take in the scene before him—an elegant, classically styled room illuminated by pockets of dim, warm light. Plush club chairs invite relaxation, while towering bookshelves stretch up to the high ceilings, adorned with a sliding library ladder. A weathered dictionary stands proudly on its own, and a delicately carved model boat of bone rests among the stacks, separated from the reading area by a tall partition of frosted glass. Parrish, standing tentatively in the doorway, surveys the room, finding nothing out of place. Startled, he steps back momentarily, his eyes scanning the space for the elusive Voice, whose familiar timbre and pitch echo with unsettling clarity.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
He carefully lowers his weary body onto the plush, inviting couch, taking great care as he places a somewhat worn folder atop his lap. As he meticulously begins to open it, he suddenly flinches, caught off guard by a sharp, unexpected spasm of pain that seizes his shoulder. This piercing sensation is both intense and fleeting, capturing his attention for a moment before he, with a slight wince of acknowledgment, decides to push the matter aside. He reasons to himself that given the swiftness with which it dissipates, it likely doesn't warrant significant concern. Feeling somewhat reassured after this brief episode, Parrish redirects his focus and attention back to the detailed examination of the folder’s contents. Yet, to his surprise and dismay, the strange pain suddenly resurfaces with a jarring abruptness. Parrish, caught off guard and filled with confusion, darts his eyes around the room, seeking the source of a strange, elusive sound that seems to surround him yet originates from no clear direction. 

Without warning, the pain intensifies with a vicious, unyielding force, compelling him to sink towards the floor in sheer anguish. Desperately, he manages to grasp the corner of the sturdy desk with one hand while with the other, he clutches his shoulder and arm, struggling to cope with the excruciating grip that has overtaken the upper portion of his body with relentless might. In this crisis, Parrish clings tightly to the edge of the desk, tormented by the severe and invasive pain on one side, while an unsettling Voice appears to bombard him from the surrounding atmosphere. Each distressing sensation seems to amplify the other, rendering him overwhelmed and consumed by the dual horrors of intense physical pain and what appears to be an unsettling hallucination. He is, however, convinced that this is no mere figment of his imagination but something more tangible. Overcome by the ordeal, Parrish gasps for breath, feeling the sweat bead down his face, leaving his complexion ghostly pale. Despite this, he resolutely maintains his grasp on the desk's corner for support. Meanwhile, Susan stands at the door, hesitating momentarily, her gaze firmly fixed on the Young Man who courteously holds the door open for her as they step out onto the street. Her eyes remain intently on him; he responds with a wide, unreserved smile. Parrish, however, is hardly aware of her presence, as his mind is completely ensnared by the consuming Voice. His eyelids flutter restlessly, his expression a mix of confusion, tension, and apprehension.

Parrish finds himself in a state of bewilderment and unease, trailing behind Allison, Drew, and Quince. He perches on the edge of his seat, as though barely able to restrain the rising tide of panic within him. The surrounding conversation swirls in the air around him, yet he remains oblivious, almost deaf to the multitude of voices. Trapped in a state of shock and striving to gather his composure, Parrish is momentarily served by Coyle, prompting him to glance towards Luisa. Even then, he remains dumbfounded, grappling with a whirlwind of anxiety. Parrish endeavors to muster the necessary courage to leave as Allison continues to make her point. Finally, with determination in his step, he rises from the table and begins to make his way out. Allison is poised to press her argument further but eventually succumbs to a silence filled with disappointment as Parrish departs the room. He moves with deliberate, measured steps down the hall, slowing his pace as he nears the doorway to the library.

The door stands ajar, inviting yet daunting, as he hesitates before cautiously stepping over the threshold. His eyes take in the elegant scene before him—a classically styled room that is softly illuminated by pockets of dim, warm light. Plush, inviting club chairs beckon relaxation, while towering bookshelves stretch upwards, reaching the high ceilings and adorned with a sliding library ladder. A weathered dictionary stands proudly, commanding its own space, while a delicately carved model boat made of bone rests among the vast collection of stacks, separated from the reading area by a tall, elegant partition of frosted glass. Parrish, standing tentatively in the doorway, surveys the room with a keen eye, finding everything seemingly in its rightful place. Startled, he steps back for a moment, his eyes darting once more as he scans the room for the elusive Voice, whose familiar timbre and pitch echo with unsettling clarity.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: He carefully lowers himself onto the couch, settling into a comfortable position before reaching for a folder that demands his attention. As he opens the folder, he is unexpectedly jolted by a sudden, sharp spasm of pain shooting through his shoulder, causing him to flinch involuntarily. The pain is intense but fleeting, and though it captures his attention momentarily, he chooses to disregard it when it does not persist, focusing instead on the task at hand. However, as he resumes perusing the folder, the pain resurfaces with alarming abruptness. His surprise is palpable as he remains still, his eyes darting around the room in a futile attempt to locate the origin of an indistinct sound that envelops him from all directions. Without warning, the discomfort crescendos into an overwhelming wave that overtakes him entirely; he feels himself sinking towards the floor. Desperately, he latches onto a corner of the desk with one hand, while his other hand reflexively grips his shoulder and arm, stricken by the violent spasms that continue to assault the upper part of his body. As he clings to the desk's edge, the pain intensifies, each wave accompanied by the pervasive presence of a Voice that seems to emanate from everywhere and nowhere, feeding into his agony and perplexity. Overwhelmed by the dual assault on his senses, he finds himself consumed by the relentless pain and the eerie certainty that what he experiences, though seemingly hallucinatory, is all too real. He is utterly possessed by these sensations, causing him to gasp and tighten his hold on the desk, sweat forming on his ashen skin. Meanwhile, Susan arrives at the door and halts abruptly, her attention fixed on a Young Man who holds the door open for her as they step out onto the street together. Susan's gaze lingers on him, to which he responds with a smile that reveals his openness and vulnerability, yet Parrish remains oblivious to her presence, his focus entirely seized by the enigmatic Voice. As his eyelids flutter, he appears nonplussed, his demeanor edgy and fearful, leaving him deeply confounded. Blindly and disconcerted, he trails behind Allison, Drew, and Quince, eventually settling into a seat. Perched on the edge, he struggles to maintain a semblance of composure, internally battling the rising tide of panic. Amidst a swirling conversation, he finds himself deaf to the encircling dialogue, his shock leaving him grappling to regain control over his faculties. When Coyle serves him, he turns to Luisa, still reeling, his mind spinning with anxiety as he attempts to muster the courage to follow Allison's ongoing discourse. Eventually, he stands from the table, intending to leave, prompting Allison to pause and sink into a silent disappointment as he exits the room. He moves with deliberate steps down the hall, his pace slowing as he nears the library's doorway. Pausing at the threshold with the door open, he hesitates, absorbing the room's details with a sweeping glance. Tentatively, he crosses into the space, taking in the serene beauty of the classic room illuminated by dim, warm light. He notes the club chairs, the towering bookshelves necessitating a rolling library ladder, a weathered dictionary on its stand, and a model boat carved from bone nestled among the shelves, all separated from the reading area by a seven-foot high partition of obscured glass. As he stands poised in the doorway, his gaze roams the room, yet finds no immediate cause for alarm, until suddenly startled, he recoils slightly, his eyes scanning for the Voice whose familiar timbre and pitch resonate with what he has previously encountered.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Parrish takes a seat on the couch, opens a folder, and experiences a sudden, sharp pain in his shoulder, which he initially ignores. As he continues to focus on the folder, the pain returns with greater intensity, and he is overwhelmed by a disorienting combination of pain and a mysterious surrounding voice. Struggling, he grabs the desk for support, clutching his shoulder and arm, as the pain engulfs him and the voice intensifies his confusion. Meanwhile, Susan pauses at the door, observing him, while the Young Man holds the door for her as they leave. Despite Susan's stare and the ongoing conversation around him, Parrish is consumed by his struggle, trying to maintain composure. As Coyle serves him, Parrish turns to Luisa, stunned and anxious, while Allison continues her conversation. Finally, he rises from the table, exiting the room deliberately. Approaching the library, he hesitates at the open door, absorbing the classic beauty of the room before tentatively entering. Startled, he shrinks back momentarily as he hears the familiar voice again, searching for its source in the room.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: He takes a seat on the couch, a vintage piece from the 1960s known for its distinctive mid-century design, opens a folder, and suddenly flinches with a spasm of pain in his shoulder. It is sharp but brief; he notices it, but since it does not continue, he ignores it. Parrish resumes looking at the folder, which contains sensitive documents related to his work as a financial analyst, when suddenly the pain returns. Frozen with surprise, Parrish's eyes search the room for the source of the sound; it comes from no particular direction, yet surrounds him like a phantom echo from an opera house. Suddenly Parrish's symptoms sharply intensify; he is sinking to the floor but somehow grabs a corner of the desk, an antique oak piece crafted in the late 19th century, holding on with one hand while clutching his shoulder and arm with the other, as the pain violently seizes the upper part of his body. Parrish grips the edge of the desk, assaulted by pain on one hand, with the Voice coming at him from the outer; each aberration feeds on the other, and he is beside himself, consumed with pain and bewildered by what seems to be a hallucination but which he is certain is not. Parrish is possessed. Parrish gasps. He holds on tight to the corner of the desk, sweat dripping, his skin ashen like marble statues weathered by years of exposure. Susan at the door now pauses abruptly, her eyes on the Young Man. The Young Man holds the door for Susan as they step out onto the bustling street lined with historic brownstones. Susan is staring at him now; he smiles, all open and vulnerable. Parrish ignores her, his attention taken by the Voice. His eyelids flutter, nonplused, edgy, and fearful. Parrish is confounded. Blindly and disconcerted, he follows Allison and Drew and Quince, his college friends who know nothing of his current turmoil. Parrish sits. Parrish is on the edge of his seat, struggling to hide his panic. The conversation swirls around Parrish, and he is deaf to it, as if wrapped in the silence of a soundproof booth. Parrish is in shock, still striving to gain control of himself. As Coyle, a seasoned caterer known for his exquisite European cuisine, serves him, Parrish turns to Luisa. Parrish is stunned. Parrish, spinning with anxiety, tries to summon up his courage to go as Allison continues, discussing the latest art exhibit at the renowned local gallery. Finally, Parrish rises from the table and starts out. Allison is about to press the point but then drifts into disappointed silence as Parrish leaves the room. Parrish moves deliberately down the hall, slowing as he nears the doorway to the library. The door is open. He hesitates before crossing the threshold, taking in as much as his eye can see; tentatively, he enters. A beautiful, classic room with areas of dim, warm light, club chairs, books reaching to the ceiling, a rolling library ladder, a weathered dictionary on a stand, and a model boat carved of bone, resembling ancient Inuit craftsmanship, set into the stacks, which are separated from the reading area by a seven-foot high partition of obscured glass. Parrish, poised in the doorway, looks around, nothing in sight. Parrish is startled; he shrinks backward for a moment, his eyes searching the room for the Voice, the timbre and pitch of which is exactly what he has heard before, reminiscent of chorales sung in grand cathedrals.

His eyelids flutter nonplused edgy and fearful. Parrish is confounded. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. Blindly and disconcerted he follows Allison and Drew and Quince. Parrish sits. Parrish is on the edge of his seat struggling to hide his panic. The conversation swirls around Parrish and he is deaf to it. Parrish is in shock still striving to gain control of himself. As Coyle serves him Parrish turns to Luisa. Parrish is stunned. Parrish spinning with anxiety tries to summon up his courage to go as Allison continues. Finally Parrish rises from the table and starts out. Allison is about to press the point but then drifts into disappointed silence as Parrish leaves the room. Parrish moves deliberately down the hall slowing as he nears the doorway to the library. The door is open. He hesitates before crossing the threshold taking in as much as his eye can see. tentatively he enters. A beautiful classic room with areas of dim warm light club chairs books reaching to the ceiling a rolling library ladder a weathered dictionary on a stand and a model boat carved of bone set into the stacks which are separated from the reading area by a sevenfoot high partition of obscured glass. Parrish poised in the doorway looks around nothing in sight. Parrish is startled. he shrinks backward for a moment his eyes searching the room for the Voice. the timbre and pitch of which is exactly what he has heard before.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: He takes a seat on the couch opens a folder and suddenly flinches with a spasm of pain in his shoulder. It is sharp but brief. he notices it but since it does not continue he ignores it. Parrish resumes looking at the folder when suddenly the pain returns. Frozen with surprise Parrish's eyes search the room for the source of the sound it comes from no particular direction yet surrounds him. Suddenly Parrish's symptoms sharply intensify. he is sinking to the floor but somehow grabs a corner of the desk holding on with one hand while clutching his shoulder and arm with the other as the pain violently seizes the upper part of his body. Parrish grips the edge of the desk assaulted by pain on one hand with the Voice coming at him from the outer. each aberration feeds on the other and he is beside himself consumed with pain and bewildered by what seems to be a hallucination but which he is certain is not. Parrish is possessed. Parrish moves deliberately down the hall slowing as he nears the doorway to the library. The door is open. He hesitates before crossing the threshold taking in as much as his eye can see. tentatively he enters. A beautiful classic room with areas of dim warm light club chairs books reaching to the ceiling a rolling library ladder a weathered dictionary on a stand and a model boat carved of bone set into the stacks which are separated from the reading area by a sevenfoot high partition of obscured glass. Parrish poised in the doorway looks around nothing in sight. Parrish is startled. he shrinks backward for a moment his eyes searching the room for the Voice. the timbre and pitch of which is exactly what he has heard before.

test_cases.description: He takes a seat on the couch opens a folder and suddenly flinches with a spasm of pain in his shoulder. It is sharp but brief. he notices it but since it does not continue he ignores it. Parrish resumes looking at the folder when suddenly the pain returns. Parrish poised in the doorway looks around nothing in sight. Parrish is startled. he shrinks backward for a moment his eyes searching the room for the Voice. the timbre and pitch of which is exactly what he has heard before.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The cat perches on the tree, flips a magazine, and suddenly recoils with a twitch of discomfort in its knee. It is dull but fleeting; it observes it, but since it does not persist, it dismisses it. Mitchell resumes perusing the magazine when suddenly the discomfort returns. Paralyzed with astonishment, Mitchell's ears scan the forest for the origin of the aroma; it emanates from no specific location, yet envelops him. Suddenly Mitchell's sensations sharply escalate; he is descending onto the ground but somehow clasps a branch of the bush, holding on with one paw while clutching his knee and leg with the other, as the discomfort violently grips the lower part of his torso. Mitchell clutches the branch of the bush, barraged by discomfort on one paw, with the Whisper approaching him from the beyond; each distortion feeds on the other, and he is overwhelmed, engulfed with discomfort and mystified by what seems to be an illusion but which he is certain is not. Mitchell is overtaken. Mitchell gulps. He clutches tight to the branch of the bush, mist forming, his fur pallid. Harriet at the arch now halts suddenly, her ears on the Elder. The Elder holds the arch for Harriet as they march onto the beach. Harriet is gazing at him now; he laughs, all exposed and naive. Mitchell dismisses her, his focus stolen by the Whisper. His whiskers tremble, bewildered, antsy, and apprehensive. Mitchell is perplexed. Sightlessly and disoriented, he trails Clara and Sam and Riley. Mitchell perches. Mitchell is on the brink of his perch, endeavoring to mask his dread. The dialogue swirls around Mitchell, and he is oblivious to it. Mitchell is in disbelief, still laboring to regain composure. As Riley assists him, Mitchell turns to Gloria. Mitchell is flabbergasted. Mitchell, twirling with unease, attempts to gather his bravery to leave as Clara persists. Finally, Mitchell ascends from the stool and proceeds outward. Clara is about to emphasize the question but then drifts into disheartened muteness as Mitchell exits the den. Mitchell maneuvers purposefully down the corridor, decelerating as he approaches the archway to the study. The arch is ajar. He lingers before traversing the boundary, absorbing as much as his sight can grasp; cautiously, he steps in. An exquisite, timeless space with zones of soft, cozy gleam, armchairs, scrolls ascending to the summit, a sliding study ladder, an aged thesaurus on a pedestal, and a replica ship carved of stone placed in the columns, which are divided from the lounging section by a six-foot high screen of blurred prism. Mitchell, balanced in the archway, glances around, nothing in view. Mitchell is taken aback; he retreats backward for a minute, his ears scouring the space for the Whisper, the tone and resonance of which is precisely what he has sensed previously.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Parrish sits on the couch, wincing from a sudden sharp shoulder pain, but dismisses it when it subsides. As he reviews a folder, the pain returns, intensifying, and it's accompanied by a mysterious Voice that seems to envelop him. Overwhelmed by pain and confusion, Parrish clings to the desk, struggling with what he perceives as a hallucination. Susan and a Young Man appear at the door, and Parrish is oblivious to their presence, absorbed by the Voice. He follows Allison, Drew, and Quince blindly, trying to mask his panic amidst a conversation he's deaf to. Stunned and anxious, Parrish attempts to regain composure, interacts briefly with Luisa and Coyle, but rises in distress as Allison speaks. He exits the room, traversing the hallway slowly, pausing at the library doorway. He tentatively enters the library, a classic room with warm lighting and towering bookshelves, seeking the source of the Voice. Startled, he steps back, his eyes searching for the familiar timbre and pitch.
